{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3485684,"name":"Team 10034 Programmer","username":"Y.Sean","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/y.sean/{size}/252033_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:16:59.189Z","cooked":"

So basically what happened is, as a rookie team in Taiwan, we need to use Openmesh radio in upcoming New Taipei Regional (rule link). And seems like it doesn’t support a 5 digit team number. We are confused.

image732×577 57.8 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T16:16:59.189Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":291,"readers_count":290,"score":168.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":482288,"topic_slug":"cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio","display_username":"Team 10034 Programmer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/zero-to-robot/step-3/openmesh.html#using-the-openmeshw-om5p-radio","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Using the OpenMesh OM5P Radio — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":15}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 10034 Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio/482288/1","custom_user_title":"Team 10034 Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3485690,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:23:25.948Z","cooked":"

I’m going to suggest an email to frcteams@firstinspires.org with the screenshot and explanation you have here.

If they aren’t the ones who can fix that tool to handle a 5th digit, then they will know who can.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T16:23:25.948Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":279,"readers_count":278,"score":205.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":482288,"topic_slug":"cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio","display_username":"EricH","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":9}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4212,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"#westandwithUkraine"},"post_url":"/t/cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio/482288/2","custom_user_title":"#westandwithUkraine","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":9,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3485703,"name":"Team 10034 Programmer","username":"Y.Sean","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/y.sean/{size}/252033_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-17T16:34:35.513Z","cooked":"

By the way, the newest software to configure an Openmesh is “FRC Radio Configuration 24.0.1”, and we’re curious if 25.0.1 will be released. I can tell that this 24.0.1 configure utility is outdated, since its “More Help” link links to an outdated webpage, which is now replaced by VH-109 instructions.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-17T16:34:35.513Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":53.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482288,"topic_slug":"cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio","display_username":"Team 10034 Programmer","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4212,"username":"EricH","name":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":69619,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 10034 Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio/482288/3","custom_user_title":"Team 10034 Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3486531,"name":"Ari Meles-Braverman","username":"AriMB","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/arimb/{size}/189989_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T13:00:41.293Z","cooked":"

Unlikely they’ll be releasing an updated version now that the old radio is no longer competition legal. (That is, unless they feel the 10k+ issue warrants it.) In previous years, the programming for old control system components has continued to be made available after it was no longer legal. For example, FRC teams can still program their old cRIOs, but have to use the 2014 LabVIEW version and libraries.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-18T13:00:41.293Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":187,"readers_count":186,"score":67.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":482288,"topic_slug":"cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio","display_username":"Ari Meles-Braverman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":69619,"username":"Y.Sean","name":"Team 10034 Programmer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/y.sean/{size}/252033_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":25012,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/cannot-set-5-digit-team-number-to-openmesh-radio/482288/4","custom_user_title":"FIRST Israel CSA, FRC 5987/5951 Technical Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3486594,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-18T15:37:46.905Z","cooked":"

As it turns out, there’s a few areas where the new radio’s legality is in question, and the old radio will be used. OP is in one of them.

I would expect there to be a patch specifically for the 10K+ issue, but it may not be made widely available.
